subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Tuesday, May 15, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

The Ticker's got the GOP debate
covered

Ten Republican presidential
candidates -- Sam Brownback, Jim Gilmore, Rudy Giuliani, Mike
Huckabee, Duncan Hunter, John McCain, Mitt Romney, Ron Paul,
Tom Tancredo and Tommy Thompson -- debate in Columbia, South
Carolina at 9 p.m. ET tonight.

CNN's Political Ticker
is the place for constant real-time updates, campaign spin,
reaction and expert analysis as the GOP candidates square off.

Today on the Ticker

Rev. Jerry Falwell dies at age 73

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The Rev. Jerry Falwell, the television
minister whose 1979 founding of the Moral Majority galvanized
American religious conservatives into a political force, died
Tuesday at age 73.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/US/05/15/jerry.falwell/index.html<
/url>

***

Former deputy attorney
general: I contemplated resigning

WASHINGTON
(CNN) -- In dramatic detail former Deputy Attorney General
James Comey disclosed new information Tuesday concerning
attempts by the White House in 2004 to get Justice Department
approval for the National Security Agency's domestic
surveillance program and disclosed he had considered resigning
after disagreements about it.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/former-deputy-attorney-general-i.html

***

Gonzales sends mixed signals on role of his
departing deputy

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Attorney
General Alberto Gonzales Tuesday repeatedly placed his outgoing
deputy Paul McNulty near the center of the controversy over the
fired U.S. attorneys, saying he relied heavily on his approval.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gonzales-sends-mixed-signals-on-role-of.html

***

Gonzales heckled during speech

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Attorney General Alberto Gonzales was
interrupted by a heckler Tuesday morning while giving a speech
at the National Press Club on how to make communities safer
from violent crimes.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gonzales-heckled-during-speech.html

***

Thompson and Moore mix it up online

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former Tennessee Sen. Fred Thompson and
filmmaker Michael Moore are going at it online over Moore's
recent trip to Cuba for his health-care documentary "Sicko."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/thompson-and-moore-mix-it-up-online.html

***

Congressman fights to protect legislative
material from search warrant

WASHINGTON (CNN)
-- Government attorneys say members of Congress should not be
"given keys to the evidence locker" when investigators search
their offices for criminal wrongdoing. But a lawyer defending a
Louisiana congressman argues there's a Constitutional "sphere
of protection" against interference by the executive branch.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/congressman-fights-to-protect.html

***

Senate Dems seeking White House face tough
vote

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- As the Senate
prepares to vote on a measure that would cut off funding in
Iraq, a fascinating 2008 political subplot is emerging.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/senate-dems-seeking-white-house-face.html

***

'Make or break' session Tuesday on immigration
reform bill, senator says

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
A bipartisan group of senators and administration officials,
racing to meet a Wednesday deadline to agree to comprehensive
immigration reform bill, will meet Tuesday afternoon in what
Sen. Trent Lott, R-Mississippi, called a "make or break"
session to see if they can reach a deal.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/make-or-break-session-tuesday-on.html

***

Giuliani makes personal apology to 'poor
farmers'

DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) -- The
VonSpreckens are back on the Giuliani bandwagon.

The
VonSpreckens, self-described poor farmers from the tiny eastern
Iowa community of Olin, became big critics of presidential
candidate Rudy Giuliani after his campaign snubbed them because
they weren't millionaires.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/giuliani-makes-personal-apology-to-poor.html

***

Hotel heirs divided over Clinton and
Obama

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- As Sen. Hillary
Clinton, D-New York, and Sen. Barack Obama, D-Illinois,
continue to battle it out for money and support in the Windy
City, a prominent billionaire Chicago family has split between
the two campaigns.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/hotel-heirs-divided-over-clinton-and.html

***

Dodd launches ad attacking challengers on
Iraq

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Connecticut Sen.
Chris Dodd launched his first campaign ad Tuesday, sharply
criticizing the other Democratic presidential candidates for
not supporting a bill that would require all troops to redeploy
from Iraq by March 31, 2008.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/dodd-launches-ad-attacking-challengers.html
